00053 /**
00054  * Basic constructor.
00055  */
00056 QuantMedian::QuantMedian(bool doMean, bool attenuate, float l, float h) { 
00057   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00058   m_Type = std::string(QUANTMEDIANSTR);
00059   m_DoMean = doMean;
00060   m_Attenuate = attenuate;
00061   m_L = l;
00062   m_H = h;
00063   setOptValue("mean", m_DoMean);
00064   setOptValue("attenuate", m_Attenuate);
00065   setOptValue("l", ToStr(m_L));
00066   setOptValue("h", ToStr(m_H));
00067   m_ChipCount = 0;
00068   m_ProbeCount = 0;
00069 }

00083 /** 
00084  * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00085  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00086  * @return feature (probe) effects.
00087  */
00088 double QuantMedian::getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx) { 
00089   Err::errAbort("QuantMedian::getFeatureEffect() - Don't have feature effects.");
00090   return 0.0;
00091 }
00092   
00093 /** 
00094  * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00095  * primary interest.
00096  * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00097  * @return estimated intensity.
00098  */
00099 double QuantMedian::getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx) {
00100   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount);
00101   return m_Summaries[chipIx];
00102 }
00103 
00104 /** 
00105  * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by
00106  * model). Supplied as log_2() transformed.
00107  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00108  * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00109  * @return intensity not explained by model.
00110  */
00111 double QuantMedian::getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00112   Err::errAbort("QuantMedian::getResidual() - Don't have residuals.");
00113   return 0.0;
00114 }

00116 /** 
00117  * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00118  * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00119  * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00120  * @return estimated intensity.
00121  */
00122 double QuantMedian::getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx) {
00123   return getTargetEffect(chipIx);
00124 }

00127 /** 
00128  * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00129  * 
00130  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00131  * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00132  * @param data - Data to be set.
00133  */
00134 void QuantMedian::setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00135   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00136   m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = (float)data;
00137 }

00140  * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00141  * 
00142  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00143  * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00144  */
00145 double QuantMedian::getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00146   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00147   return (double) m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];

00168   return  Linear;

00183 /** 
00184  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00185  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00186  */
00187 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> QuantMedian::getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00188   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00189   SelfDoc::Opt expon = {"mean", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00190                         "Use the mean rather than the median."};
00191   opts.push_back(expon);
00192   SelfDoc::Opt attenuate = {"attenuate", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00193                             "Indicate whether or not to attenuate mismatch value when using non-PM-only adjuster."};
00194   opts.push_back(attenuate);
00195   SelfDoc::Opt l = {"l", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.005", "0.005", "0", "1",
00196                     "Tunable parameter for attenuating mismatch value for non-PM-only adjusters."};
00197   opts.push_back(l);
00198   SelfDoc::Opt h = {"h", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "-1", "-1", "-1", "NA",
00199                     "Used fixed constant to attenuate mismatch."};
00200   opts.push_back(h);
00201     
00202   return opts;
00203 }

00205 /** 
00206  * Fill in the infomediantion for Self documentation.
00207  * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00208  */
00209 void QuantMedian::setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00210   doc.setDocName(QUANTMEDIANSTR);
00211   doc.setDocDescription("Use the median of probes for a particular chip as the summary.");
00212   doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00213 }

00215 /** 
00216  * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00217  * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00218  * @return SelfDoc
00219  */
00220 SelfDoc QuantMedian::explainSelf() { 
00221   SelfDoc doc;
00222   setupSelfDoc(doc);
00223   return doc;
00224 }

00226 /** 
00227  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00228  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00229  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00230  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00231  * 
00232  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00233  * 
00234  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00235  */
00236 SelfCreate *QuantMedian::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00237   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00238   bool mean = false;
00239   bool attenuate = true;
00240   float l = 0.005;
00241   float h = -1;
00242   fillInValue(mean, "mean", param, doc);
00243   fillInValue(attenuate, "attenuate", param, doc);
00244   fillInValue(l, "l", param, doc);
00245   fillInValue(h, "h", param, doc);
00246   QuantMedian *median = new QuantMedian(mean,attenuate,l,h);
00247   return median;
00248 }

00250 /** 
00251  * @brief Clear out all the data.
00252  */
00253 void QuantMedian::clear() {
00254   unsigned int probeIx = 0, chipIx = 0;
00255   m_ChipCount = 0;
00256   m_ProbeCount = 0;
00257   // Set the world to 0
00258   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_PM.size(); chipIx++) {
00259     for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < m_PM[0].size(); probeIx++) {
00260       m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00261       m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00262     }
00263   }
00264   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_Summaries.size(); chipIx++) 
00265     m_Summaries[chipIx] = 0;
00266 }
00267 
00268 /** 
00269  * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00270  * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00271  * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00272  */
00273 void QuantMedian::setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips) {
00274   unsigned int i = 0;
00275   m_ProbeCount = numProbes;
00276   m_ChipCount = numChips;
00277   /* Check empty case. */
00278   if(m_PM.empty()) {
00279     m_Summaries.resize(numChips);
00280     while(m_PM.size() < numChips) {
00281       m_PM.push_back(vector<float>(numProbes));
00282       m_MM.push_back(vector<float>(numProbes));
00283     }
00284   }
00285   /* Check number of columns (probes). */
00286   if(numProbes > m_PM[0].size()) {
00287     for(i = 0; i < m_PM.size(); i++) {
00288       m_PM[i].resize(numProbes);
00289       m_MM[i].resize(numProbes);
00290     }
00291   }
00292   /* Check number of rows (chips). */
00293   if(numChips > m_PM.size()) {
00294     m_Summaries.resize(numChips);
00295     while(m_PM.size() < numChips) {
00296       m_PM.push_back(vector<float>(m_PM[0].size()));
00297       m_MM.push_back(vector<float>(m_MM[0].size()));
00298     }
00299   }
00300 }
00301 
00302 /** 
00303  * @brief Compute median. If PM-MM is zero
00304  * threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of
00305  * numbers that aren't positive.
00306  */
00307 void QuantMedian::computeEstimate() {
00308   float intensity = 0;
00309   unsigned int colIx = 0, rowIx = 0;
00310   
00311   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < m_ChipCount; rowIx++) {
00312     for(colIx = 0; colIx < m_ProbeCount; colIx++) {
00313       if(m_Attenuate) {
00314         intensity = attenuateIntensity(m_PM[rowIx][colIx],m_MM[rowIx][colIx],m_L,m_H);
00315       }
00316       else {
00317         intensity = m_PM[rowIx][colIx] - m_MM[rowIx][colIx];
00318       }
00319       m_PM[rowIx][colIx] = intensity;
00320     }
00321   }
00322   // calculate the medians
00323   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < m_ChipCount; rowIx++) {
00324     if(m_DoMean) {
00325       m_Summaries[rowIx] = average(m_PM[rowIx].begin(), m_PM[rowIx].begin() + m_ProbeCount);
00326     }
00327     else {
00328       m_Summaries[rowIx] = median(m_PM[rowIx].begin(), m_PM[rowIx].begin() + m_ProbeCount);
00329     }
00330   }
00331 }
00332 
00333 /** 
00334  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00335  * set, chip layout and data.
00336  * 
00337  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00338  * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00339  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00340  * @param iTrans - Transfomediantions to be applied to data before use.
00341  * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00342  * @return bool - True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00343  */
00344 bool QuantMedian::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00345                         std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00346   unsigned int chipIx = 0, probeIx = 0, psIx, atomIx = 0;
00347   unsigned int chipCount = 0, atomPmCount = 0;
00348   float intensity = 0.0;
00349 
00350   assert(psGroup.probeSets.size() > 0);
00351   chipCount = iMart.getCelFileCount();
00352   atomPmCount = psGroup.countPmProbes();
00353   if(atomPmCount == 0)
00354     return false;
00355   /* Prepare the quantification method for this many atoms and chips. */
00356   setBounds(atomPmCount, chipCount);
00357   
00358   atomPmCount = 0;
00359   m_Probes.clear();
00360   /* Loop through and fill in the data as coming from the intensity mart. */
00361   for(psIx = 0; psIx < psGroup.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00362     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[psIx];
00363     if(ps == NULL)
00364       continue;
00365     for(atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00366       Atom &atom = *(ps->atoms[atomIx]);
00367       unsigned int channelIx = atom.getChannelCode();
00368       for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00369         Probe *p = atom.probes[probeIx];
00370         if(p->type == Probe::PMST || p->type == Probe::PMAT) {
00371           unsigned int probeIndex = p->id;
00372           m_Probes.push_back(p);
00373           for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < chipCount; chipIx++) {
00374             /* PM transformation. */
00375             intensity = transformPrimaryData(probeIndex, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, channelIx);
00376             float mmIntensity = 0;
00377             /* MM transformation. */
00378             ///@todo use channel to fetch/set correct values
00379             pmAdjust.pmAdjustment(probeIndex, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, intensity, mmIntensity);
00380             setPMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, intensity);
00381             setMMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, mmIntensity);
00382           }
00383           atomPmCount++;
00384         }
00385       }
00386     } /* atoms. */
00387   } /* probe sets. */
00388   return true;
00389 }
